landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges a lease-like rental relationship: Plaintiff began renting the apartment on or about May 1, 2022, pays monthly rent of $1,200, and identifies Defendant as the owner/landlord of 123 Elm Street (¶¶1–4).

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges affirmative and omissive conduct by Defendant: he placed a few spring traps and authorized a single exterminator visit but refused to authorize comprehensive or repeated extermination and told Plaintiff rodents were "normal" (¶¶8–10, 13, 17).

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges ongoing, repeated rodent activity (weekly droppings), contamination of food, loss of use of the kitchen (interference with cooking/eating), and attendant anxiety and distress—facts pled as materially interfering with habitability and ordinary use (¶¶7–12, 17–18).

causation.reasoning: Complaint links Defendant's refusal to authorize comprehensive, recommended extermination and failure to remediate to the continued infestation and resulting harms: Plaintiff notified Defendant, an exterminator recommended building‑wide treatment, Defendant refused, and the infestation persisted causing the alleged losses (¶¶7–11, 13–14, 17).

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges specific economic losses ($200 of discarded food and $80 for rodent‑proof containers, totaling $280) and non-economic damages (loss of use, discomfort, anxiety, ongoing interference) (¶¶11–12, 19; Prayer A).
